io.github.anagalacticruby

Class ProductionRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.anagalacticruby.ProductionRecord

  • class ProductionRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is where the data about a product's production record is managed.

    The information will be posted in the Production Log's text area after the record production button is pressed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProductionRecord(int productID)
      A constructor that takes only the productID of a recorded product and sets the details to the 'factory default'.
      ProductionRecord(int productionNumber, int productID, java.lang.String serialNumber, java.util.Date dateProduced)
      A constructor that will be used by the database later to retrieve recorded products.
      ProductionRecord(Product product, int itemCount)
      A constructor that takes a product and the amount of said products that need to be produced.

      • ProductionRecord

        ProductionRecord(int productID)
        A constructor that takes only the productID of a recorded product and sets the details to the 'factory default'.
        Parameters:
        productID - Takes in the value meant to represent a productID

      • ProductionRecord

        ProductionRecord(int productionNumber,
                 int productID,
                 java.lang.String serialNumber,
                 java.util.Date dateProduced)
        A constructor that will be used by the database later to retrieve recorded products.
        Parameters:
        productionNumber - The production number of a recorded product
        productID - The productID of a recorded product
        serialNumber - The serial number of a recorded product
        dateProduced - The date that a recorded product has been produced on

      • ProductionRecord

        ProductionRecord(Product product,
                 int itemCount)
        A constructor that takes a product and the amount of said products that need to be produced.

        It generates a special serial number for each product passed in.

        Parameters:
        product - The product that needs to be recorded
        itemCount - How many times this product has been created

    • Method Detail

      • getDateProduced

        public java.util.Date getDateProduced()
        An accessor for the date that which a product has been produced.

        Note that it is a real date updated in real time.

        Returns:
        A Date value (Essentially a long) that represents the date that a product was recorded to be produced on on

        An accessor for the productID of a recorded product.

        An accessor for the production number of a recorded product.

        public java.lang.String getSerialNumber()
        An accessor for the serial number of a product that has been recorded.
        Returns:
        A String containing the serial number of a product

        A mutator for the date that which a product has been produced.

        A mutator that sets the current productID of a recorded product to the one passed in.
        Parameters:

      • setProductionNumber

        public void setProductionNumber(int productionNumber)
        A mutator that sets the production number of a recorded product to the one passed in.
        Parameters:
        productionNumber - The new production number that will be replacing the old one.

      • setSerialNumber

        public void setSerialNumber(java.lang.String serialNumber)
        A mutator that sets the value of a recorded product's serial number.
        Parameters:
        serialNumber - Takes in a String that holds the new serial number to set the old one to

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A toString method that will return the details of a recorded product.

        This information is printed in the Production Log tab's text area.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing the production number, ID, serial number, and date produced of a recorded product
